packageNLS.css.title: CSS
packageNLS.css.customData.desc:
A list of relative file paths pointing to JSON files following the [custom data format](https://github.com/microsoft/vscode-css-languageservice/blob/master/docs/customData.md).

VS Code loads custom data on startup to enhance its CSS support for the custom CSS properties, at directives, pseudo classes and pseudo elements you specify in the JSON files.

The file paths are relative to workspace and only workspace folder settings are considered.
packageNLS.css.completion.triggerPropertyValueCompl: By default, VS Code triggers property value completion after selecting a CSS property. Use this setting to disable this behavior.
packageNLS.css.completion.completePropertyWithSemic: Insert semicolon at end of line when completing CSS properties
packageNLS.css.lint.boxModel.desc: Do not use `width` or `height` when using `padding` or `border`.
packageNLS.css.lint.compatibleVendorPrefixes.desc: When using a vendor-specific prefix make sure to also include all other vendor-specific properties.
packageNLS.css.lint.duplicateProperties.desc: Do not use duplicate style definitions.
packageNLS.css.lint.float.desc: Avoid using `float`. Floats lead to fragile CSS that is easy to break if one aspect of the layout changes.
packageNLS.css.lint.hexColorLength.desc: Hex colors must consist of three or six hex numbers.
packageNLS.css.lint.idSelector.desc: Selectors should not contain IDs because these rules are too tightly coupled with the HTML.
packageNLS.css.lint.ieHack.desc: IE hacks are only necessary when supporting IE7 and older.
packageNLS.css.lint.important.desc: Avoid using `!important`. It is an indication that the specificity of the entire CSS has gotten out of control and needs to be refactored.
packageNLS.css.lint.importStatement.desc: Import statements do not load in parallel.
packageNLS.css.lint.propertyIgnoredDueToDisplay.des: Property is ignored due to the display. E.g. with `display: inline`, the `width`, `height`, `margin-top`, `margin-bottom`, and `float` properties have no effect.
packageNLS.css.lint.universalSelector.desc: The universal selector (`*`) is known to be slow.
packageNLS.css.lint.validProperties.desc: A list of properties that are not validated against the `unknownProperties` rule.
packageNLS.css.lint.vendorPrefix.desc: When using a vendor-specific prefix, also include the standard property.
packageNLS.css.trace.server.desc: Traces the communication between VS Code and the CSS language server.
packageNLS.css.validate.title: Controls CSS validation and problem severities.

packageNLS.less.completion.triggerPropertyValueComp: By default, VS Code triggers property value completion after selecting a CSS property. Use this setting to disable this behavior.

packageNLS.description: Provides syntax highlighting and bracket matching in Docker files.
Emmet support for VS Code
packageNLS.emmetSyntaxProfiles: Define profile for specified syntax or use your own profile with specific rules.
packageNLS.emmetExclude: An array of languages where Emmet abbreviations should not be expanded.
packageNLS.emmetExtensionsPath: Path to a folder containing Emmet profiles and snippets.
packageNLS.emmetShowExpandedAbbreviation:
Shows expanded Emmet abbreviations as suggestions.
The option `"inMarkupAndStylesheetFilesOnly"` applies to html, haml, jade, slim, xml, xsl, css, scss, sass, less and stylus.
The option `"always"` applies to all parts of the file regardless of markup/css.
packageNLS.emmetShowAbbreviationSuggestions: Shows possible Emmet abbreviations as suggestions. Not applicable in stylesheets or when emmet.showExpandedAbbreviation is set to `"never"`.
packageNLS.emmetIncludeLanguages:
Enable Emmet abbreviations in languages that are not supported by default. Add a mapping here between the language and emmet supported language.
 E.g.: `{"vue-html": "html", "javascript": "javascriptreact"}`
packageNLS.emmetVariables: Variables to be used in Emmet snippets
packageNLS.emmetTriggerExpansionOnTab: When enabled, Emmet abbreviations are expanded when pressing TAB.
packageNLS.emmetPreferences: Preferences used to modify behavior of some actions and resolvers of Emmet.
packageNLS.emmetPreferencesCssAfter: Symbol to be placed at the end of CSS property when expanding CSS abbreviations
packageNLS.emmetPreferencesSassAfter: Symbol to be placed at the end of CSS property when expanding CSS abbreviations in Sass files
packageNLS.emmetPreferencesStylusAfter: Symbol to be placed at the end of CSS property when expanding CSS abbreviations in Stylus files
packageNLS.emmetPreferencesCssBetween: Symbol to be placed at the between CSS property and value when expanding CSS abbreviations
packageNLS.emmetPreferencesSassBetween: Symbol to be placed at the between CSS property and value when expanding CSS abbreviations in Sass files
packageNLS.emmetPreferencesStylusBetween: Symbol to be placed at the between CSS property and value when expanding CSS abbreviations in Stylus files
packageNLS.emmetShowSuggestionsAsSnippets: If `true`, then Emmet suggestions will show up as snippets allowing you to order them as per `#editor.snippetSuggestions#` setting.
packageNLS.emmetPreferencesBemElementSeparator: Element separator used for classes when using the BEM filter
packageNLS.emmetPreferencesBemModifierSeparator: Modifier separator used for classes when using the BEM filter
packageNLS.emmetPreferencesFilterCommentBefore: A definition of comment that should be placed before matched element when comment filter is applied.
packageNLS.emmetPreferencesFilterCommentAfter: A definition of comment that should be placed after matched element when comment filter is applied.
packageNLS.emmetPreferencesFilterCommentTrigger: A comma-separated list of attribute names that should exist in abbreviation for the comment filter to be applied
packageNLS.emmetPreferencesFormatNoIndentTags: An array of tag names that should not get inner indentation
packageNLS.emmetPreferencesFormatForceIndentTags: An array of tag names that should always get inner indentation
packageNLS.emmetPreferencesAllowCompactBoolean: If true, compact notation of boolean attributes are produced
packageNLS.emmetPreferencesCssWebkitProperties: Comma separated CSS properties that get the 'webkit' vendor prefix when used in Emmet abbreviation that starts with `-`. Set to empty string to always avoid the 'webkit' prefix.
packageNLS.emmetPreferencesCssMozProperties: Comma separated CSS properties that get the 'moz' vendor prefix when used in Emmet abbreviation that starts with `-`. Set to empty string to always avoid the 'moz' prefix.
packageNLS.emmetPreferencesCssOProperties: Comma separated CSS properties that get the 'o' vendor prefix when used in Emmet abbreviation that starts with `-`. Set to empty string to always avoid the 'o' prefix.
packageNLS.emmetPreferencesCssMsProperties: Comma separated CSS properties that get the 'ms' vendor prefix when used in Emmet abbreviation that starts with `-`. Set to empty string to always avoid the 'ms' prefix.
packageNLS.emmetPreferencesCssFuzzySearchMinScore: The minimum score (from 0 to 1) that fuzzy-matched abbreviation should achieve. Lower values may produce many false-positive matches, higher values may reduce possible matches.
packageNLS.emmetOptimizeStylesheetParsing: When set to `false`, the whole file is parsed to determine if current position is valid for expanding Emmet abbreviations. When set to `true`, only the content around the current position in css/scss/less files is parsed.

packageNLS.description: Provides linting capabilities for authoring extensions.
Provides snippets, syntax highlighting, bracket matching and folding in F# files.
GitHub Authentication Provider
Provides syntax highlighting and bracket matching in Go files.
Provides snippets, syntax highlighting and bracket matching in Groovy files.
Provides syntax highlighting and bracket matching in Handlebars files.
Provides syntax highlighting and bracket matching in HLSL files.
Provides syntax highlighting, bracket matching & snippets in HTML files.
Provides rich language support for HTML and Handlebar files
packageNLS.html.customData.desc:
A list of relative file paths pointing to JSON files following the [custom data format](https://github.com/microsoft/vscode-html-languageservice/blob/master/docs/customData.md).

VS Code loads custom data on startup to enhance its HTML support for the custom HTML tags, attributes and attribute values you specify in the JSON files.

The file paths are relative to workspace and only workspace folder settings are considered.
packageNLS.html.format.wrapLineLength.desc: Maximum amount of characters per line (0 = disable).
packageNLS.html.format.unformatted.desc: List of tags, comma separated, that shouldn't be reformatted. `null` defaults to all tags listed at https://www.w3.org/TR/html5/dom.html#phrasing-content.
packageNLS.html.format.contentUnformatted.desc: List of tags, comma separated, where the content shouldn't be reformatted. `null` defaults to the `pre` tag.
packageNLS.html.format.preserveNewLines.desc: Controls whether existing line breaks before elements should be preserved. Only works before elements, not inside tags or for text.
packageNLS.html.format.maxPreserveNewLines.desc: Maximum number of line breaks to be preserved in one chunk. Use `null` for unlimited.
packageNLS.html.format.extraLiners.desc: List of tags, comma separated, that should have an extra newline before them. `null` defaults to `"head, body, /html"`.
packageNLS.html.format.wrapAttributes.auto: Wrap attributes only when line length is exceeded.
packageNLS.html.format.wrapAttributes.forcealign: Wrap each attribute except first and keep aligned.
packageNLS.html.format.wrapAttributes.alignedmultip: Wrap when line length is exceeded, align attributes vertically.
packageNLS.html.format.wrapAttributes.preservealign: Preserve wrapping of attributes but align.
packageNLS.html.format.templating.desc: Honor django, erb, handlebars and php templating language tags.
Keep text content together between this string.
packageNLS.html.format.wrapAttributesIndentSize.des: Alignment size when using 'force aligned' and 'aligned multiple' in `#html.format.wrapAttributes#` or `null` to use the default indent size.
packageNLS.html.suggest.html5.desc: Controls whether the built-in HTML language support suggests HTML5 tags, properties and values.
packageNLS.html.trace.server.desc: Traces the communication between VS Code and the HTML language server.
packageNLS.html.validate.scripts: Controls whether the built-in HTML language support validates embedded scripts.
packageNLS.html.validate.styles: Controls whether the built-in HTML language support validates embedded styles.
packageNLS.html.mirrorCursorOnMatchingTag: Enable/disable mirroring cursor on matching HTML tag.
packageNLS.html.hover.documentation: Show tag and attribute documentation in hover.
packageNLS.html.hover.references: Show references to MDN in hover.

packageNLS.description: Provides VS Code's built-in image preview

Provides snippets, syntax highlighting, bracket matching and folding in JavaScript files.

Provides rich language support for JSON files.
packageNLS.json.schemas.desc: Associate schemas to JSON files in the current project
packageNLS.json.schemas.url.desc: A URL to a schema or a relative path to a schema in the current directory
packageNLS.json.schemas.fileMatch.desc: An array of file patterns to match against when resolving JSON files to schemas. `*` can be used as a wildcard. Exclusion patterns can also be defined and start with '!'. A file matches when there is at least one matching pattern and the last matching pattern is not an exclusion pattern.
packageNLS.json.schemas.fileMatch.item.desc: A file pattern that can contain '*' to match against when resolving JSON files to schemas.
packageNLS.json.schemas.schema.desc: The schema definition for the given URL. The schema only needs to be provided to avoid accesses to the schema URL.
packageNLS.json.tracing.desc: Traces the communication between VS Code and the JSON language server.
packageNLS.json.colorDecorators.enable.deprecationM: The setting `json.colorDecorators.enable` has been deprecated in favor of `editor.colorDecorators`.
packageNLS.json.maxItemsComputed.desc: The maximum number of outline symbols and folding regions computed (limited for performance reasons).
packageNLS.json.maxItemsExceededInformation.desc: Show notification when exceeding the maximum number of outline symbols and folding regions.
packageNLS.json.enableSchemaDownload.desc: When enabled, JSON schemas can be fetched from http and https locations.

packageNLS.description: Provides rich language support for Markdown.
packageNLS.markdown.preview.breaks.desc:
Sets how line-breaks are rendered in the markdown preview. Setting it to 'true' creates a
for newlines inside paragraphs.
packageNLS.markdown.preview.linkify: Enable or disable conversion of URL-like text to links in the markdown preview.
packageNLS.markdown.preview.doubleClickToSwitchToEd: Double click in the markdown preview to switch to the editor.
packageNLS.markdown.preview.fontFamily.desc: Controls the font family used in the markdown preview.
packageNLS.markdown.preview.fontSize.desc: Controls the font size in pixels used in the markdown preview.
packageNLS.markdown.preview.lineHeight.desc: Controls the line height used in the markdown preview. This number is relative to the font size.
packageNLS.markdown.preview.markEditorSelection.des: Mark the current editor selection in the markdown preview.
packageNLS.markdown.preview.scrollEditorWithPreview: When a markdown preview is scrolled, update the view of the editor.
packageNLS.markdown.preview.scrollPreviewWithEditor: When a markdown editor is scrolled, update the view of the preview.
packageNLS.markdown.preview.title: Open Preview
packageNLS.markdown.previewSide.title: Open Preview to the Side
packageNLS.markdown.showLockedPreviewToSide.title: Open Locked Preview to the Side
packageNLS.markdown.showSource.title: Show Source
packageNLS.markdown.styles.dec: A list of URLs or local paths to CSS style sheets to use from the markdown preview. Relative paths are interpreted relative to the folder open in the explorer. If there is no open folder, they are interpreted relative to the location of the markdown file. All '\' need to be written as '\\'.
packageNLS.markdown.trace.desc: Enable debug logging for the markdown extension.
packageNLS.markdown.preview.refresh.title: Refresh Preview
packageNLS.markdown.preview.toggleLock.title: Toggle Preview Locking
packageNLS.configuration.markdown.preview.openMarkd: Controls how links to other markdown files in the markdown preview should be opened.
Try to open links in the editor
Try to open links in the markdown preview
packageNLS.configuration.markdown.links.openLocatio: Controls where links in markdown files should be opened.

packageNLS.config.title: Merge Conflict
packageNLS.config.autoNavigateNextConflictEnabled: Whether to automatically navigate to the next merge conflict after resolving a merge conflict.
packageNLS.config.codeLensEnabled: Create a CodeLens for merge conflict blocks within editor.
packageNLS.config.decoratorsEnabled: Create decorators for merge conflict blocks within editor.
packageNLS.config.diffViewPosition: Controls where the diff view should be opened when comparing changes in merge conflicts.
packageNLS.config.diffViewPosition.current: Open the diff view in the current editor group.
packageNLS.config.diffViewPosition.beside: Open the diff view next to the current editor group.
packageNLS.config.diffViewPosition.below: Open the diff view below the current editor group.

packageNLS.config.npm.packageManager.yarn: Use yarn as the package manager for running scripts.

packageNLS.config.npm.exclude: Configure glob patterns for folders that should be excluded from automatic script detection.
packageNLS.config.npm.enableScriptExplorer: Enable an explorer view for npm scripts when there is no top-level 'package.json' file.
packageNLS.config.npm.scriptExplorerAction: The default click action used in the npm scripts explorer: `open` or `run`, the default is `open`.
packageNLS.config.npm.enableRunFromFolder: Enable running npm scripts contained in a folder from the Explorer context menu.
packageNLS.config.npm.fetchOnlinePackageInfo: Fetch data from https://registry.npmjs.org and https://registry.bower.io to provide auto-completion and information on hover features on npm dependencies.

beginsPattern.regexp: ^\s*(?:message TS6032:|\[?\D*\d{1,2}[:.]\d{1,2}[:.]\d{1,2}\D*(├\D*\d{1,2}\D+┤)?(?:\]| -)) File change detected\. Starting incremental compilation\.\.\.

endsPattern.regexp: ^\s*(?:message TS6042:|\[?\D*\d{1,2}[:.]\d{1,2}[:.]\d{1,2}\D*(├\D*\d{1,2}\D+┤)?(?:\]| -)) (?:Compilation complete\.|Found \d+ errors?\.) Watching for file changes\.

packageNLS.description: Provides rich language support for JavaScript and TypeScript.
packageNLS.reloadProjects.title: Reload Project
packageNLS.configuration.suggest.completeFunctionCa: Complete functions with their parameter signature.
packageNLS.configuration.suggest.includeAutomaticOp: Enable/disable showing completions on potentially undefined values that insert an optional chain call. Requires TS 3.7+ and strict null checks to be enabled.
packageNLS.typescript.tsdk.desc:
Specifies the folder path to the tsserver and lib*.d.ts files under a TypeScript install to use for IntelliSense, for example: `./node_modules/typescript/lib`.

- When specified as a user setting, the TypeScript version from `typescript.tsdk` automatically replaces the built-in TypeScript version.
- When specified as a workspace setting, `typescript.tsdk` allows you to switch to use that workspace version of TypeScript for IntelliSense with the `TypeScript: Select TypeScript version` command.

See the [TypeScript documentation](https://code.visualstudio.com/docs/typescript/typescript-compiling#_using-newer-typescript-versions) for more detail about managing TypeScript versions.
packageNLS.typescript.disableAutomaticTypeAcquisiti: Disables automatic type acquisition. Automatic type acquisition fetches `@types` packages from npm to improve IntelliSense for external libraries.
packageNLS.typescript.enablePromptUseWorkspaceTsdk: Enables prompting of users to use the TypeScript version configured in the workspace for Intellisense.
packageNLS.typescript.tsserver.enableTracing: Enables tracing TS server performance to a directory. These trace files can be used to diagnose TS Server performance issues. The log may contain file paths, source code, and other potentially sensitive information from your project.
packageNLS.typescript.tsserver.log: Enables logging of the TS server to a file. This log can be used to diagnose TS Server issues. The log may contain file paths, source code, and other potentially sensitive information from your project.
packageNLS.typescript.tsserver.pluginPaths: Additional paths to discover TypeScript Language Service plugins.
packageNLS.typescript.tsserver.pluginPaths.item: Either an absolute or relative path. Relative path will be resolved against workspace folder(s).
packageNLS.typescript.tsserver.trace: Enables tracing of messages sent to the TS server. This trace can be used to diagnose TS Server issues. The trace may contain file paths, source code, and other potentially sensitive information from your project.
packageNLS.format.insertSpaceAfterCommaDelimiter: Defines space handling after a comma delimiter.
packageNLS.format.insertSpaceAfterConstructor: Defines space handling after the constructor keyword.
packageNLS.format.insertSpaceAfterSemicolonInForSta: Defines space handling after a semicolon in a for statement.
packageNLS.format.insertSpaceBeforeAndAfterBinaryOp: Defines space handling after a binary operator.
packageNLS.format.insertSpaceAfterKeywordsInControl: Defines space handling after keywords in a control flow statement.
packageNLS.format.insertSpaceAfterFunctionKeywordFo: Defines space handling after function keyword for anonymous functions.
packageNLS.format.insertSpaceBeforeFunctionParenthe: Defines space handling before function argument parentheses.
packageNLS.format.insertSpaceAfterOpeningAndBeforeC: Defines space handling after opening and before closing non-empty parenthesis.
Defines space handling after opening and before closing non-empty brackets.
Defines space handling after opening and before closing non-empty braces.
Defines space handling after opening and before closing empty braces.
Defines space handling after opening and before closing template string braces.
Defines space handling after opening and before closing JSX expression braces.
packageNLS.format.insertSpaceAfterTypeAssertion: Defines space handling after type assertions in TypeScript.
packageNLS.format.placeOpenBraceOnNewLineForFunctio: Defines whether an open brace is put onto a new line for functions or not.
packageNLS.format.placeOpenBraceOnNewLineForControl: Defines whether an open brace is put onto a new line for control blocks or not.
packageNLS.format.semicolons: Defines handling of optional semicolons. Requires using TypeScript 3.7 or newer in the workspace.
packageNLS.format.semicolons.ignore: Don't insert or remove any semicolons.
packageNLS.goToProjectConfig.title: Go to Project Configuration
packageNLS.javascript.referencesCodeLens.enabled: Enable/disable references CodeLens in JavaScript files.
packageNLS.javascript.referencesCodeLens.showOnAllF: Enable/disable references CodeLens on all functions in JavaScript files.
packageNLS.typescript.referencesCodeLens.enabled: Enable/disable references CodeLens in TypeScript files.
packageNLS.typescript.referencesCodeLens.showOnAllF: Enable/disable references CodeLens on all functions in TypeScript files.
packageNLS.typescript.implementationsCodeLens.enabl: Enable/disable implementations CodeLens. This CodeLens shows the implementers of an interface.
packageNLS.typescript.openTsServerLog.title: Open TS Server log
packageNLS.typescript.selectTypeScriptVersion.title: Select TypeScript Version...
packageNLS.typescript.npm: Specifies the path to the npm executable used for Automatic Type Acquisition.
packageNLS.typescript.check.npmIsInstalled: Check if npm is installed for Automatic Type Acquisition.
packageNLS.configuration.suggest.names: Enable/disable including unique names from the file in JavaScript suggestions. Note that name suggestions are always disabled in JavaScript code that is semantically checked using `@ts-check` or `checkJs`.
packageNLS.typescript.tsc.autoDetect: Controls auto detection of tsc tasks.
packageNLS.typescript.tsc.autoDetect.on: Create both build and watch tasks.
packageNLS.typescript.tsc.autoDetect.build: Only create single run compile tasks.
packageNLS.typescript.tsc.autoDetect.watch: Only create compile and watch tasks.
packageNLS.typescript.problemMatchers.tsc.label: TypeScript problems
packageNLS.configuration.suggest.paths: Enable/disable suggestions for paths in import statements and require calls.
packageNLS.configuration.tsserver.useSeparateSyntax: Enable/disable spawning a separate TypeScript server that can more quickly respond to syntax related operations, such as calculating folding or computing document symbols. Requires using TypeScript 3.4.0 or newer in the workspace.
packageNLS.configuration.tsserver.maxTsServerMemory: Set the maximum amount of memory (in MB) to allocate to the TypeScript server process
packageNLS.typescript.locale: Sets the locale used to report JavaScript and TypeScript errors. Default of `null` uses VS Code's locale.
packageNLS.configuration.implicitProjectConfig.chec: Enable/disable semantic checking of JavaScript files. Existing `jsconfig.json` or `tsconfig.json` files override this setting.
packageNLS.configuration.javascript.checkJs.checkJs: This setting has been deprecated in favor of `#js/ts.implicitProjectConfig.checkJs#`.
packageNLS.configuration.implicitProjectConfig.expe: Enable/disable `experimentalDecorators` in JavaScript files that are not part of a project. Existing `jsconfig.json` or `tsconfig.json` files override this setting.
packageNLS.configuration.javascript.checkJs.experim: This setting has been deprecated in favor of `#js/ts.implicitProjectConfig.experimentalDecorators#`.
packageNLS.configuration.implicitProjectConfig.stri: Enable/disable [strict null checks](https://www.typescriptlang.org/tsconfig#strictNullChecks) in JavaScript and TypeScript files that are not part of a project. Existing `jsconfig.json` or `tsconfig.json` files override this setting.

Enable/disable [strict function types](https://www.typescriptlang.org/tsconfig#strictFunctionTypes) in JavaScript and TypeScript files that are not part of a project. Existing `jsconfig.json` or `tsconfig.json` files override this setting.
packageNLS.taskDefinition.tsconfig.description: The tsconfig file that defines the TS build.
packageNLS.javascript.suggestionActions.enabled: Enable/disable suggestion diagnostics for JavaScript files in the editor.
packageNLS.typescript.suggestionActions.enabled: Enable/disable suggestion diagnostics for TypeScript files in the editor.
packageNLS.typescript.preferences.quoteStyle: Preferred quote style to use for quick fixes: `single` quotes, `double` quotes, or `auto` infer quote type from existing imports.
packageNLS.typescript.preferences.importModuleSpeci: Preferred path style for auto imports.
Prefers a non-relative import only if one is available that has fewer path segments than a relative import.
Prefers a relative path to the imported file location.
Prefers a non-relative import based on the `baseUrl` or `paths` configured in your `jsconfig.json` / `tsconfig.json`.
Prefers a non-relative import only if the relative import path would leave the package or project directory. Requires using TypeScript 4.2+ in the workspace.
Preferred path ending for auto imports.
Use project settings to select a default.
Do not shorten path endings; include the `.js` extension.
packageNLS.typescript.preferences.includePackageJso: Enable/disable searching `package.json` dependencies for available auto imports.
Search dependencies based on estimated performance impact.
packageNLS.typescript.updateImportsOnFileMove.enabl: Enable/disable automatic updating of import paths when you rename or move a file in VS Code.
Never rename paths and don't prompt.
packageNLS.typescript.autoClosingTags: Enable/disable automatic closing of JSX tags.
packageNLS.configuration.surveys.enabled: Enabled/disable occasional surveys that help us improve VS Code's JavaScript and TypeScript support.
packageNLS.configuration.suggest.completeJSDocs: Enable/disable suggestion to complete JSDoc comments.
packageNLS.configuration.tsserver.watchOptions: Configure which watching strategies should be used to keep track of files and directories. Requires using TypeScript 3.8+ in the workspace.
packageNLS.configuration.tsserver.watchOptions.watc: Strategy for how individual files are watched.
Check every file for changes several times a second at a fixed interval.
Check every file for changes several times a second, but use heuristics to check certain types of files less frequently than others.
Use a dynamic queue where less-frequently modified files will be checked less often.
Attempt to use the operating system/file system’s native events for file changes.
Attempt to use the operating system/file system’s native events to listen for changes on a file’s containing directories. This can use fewer file watchers, but might be less accurate.
Strategy for how entire directory trees are watched under systems that lack recursive file-watching functionality.
Check every directory for changes several times a second at a fixed interval.
Use a dynamic queue where less-frequently modified directories will be checked less often.
Attempt to use the operating system/file system’s native events for directory changes.
packageNLS.configuration.tsserver.watchOptions.fall: When using file system events, this option specifies the polling strategy that gets used when the system runs out of native file watchers and/or doesn’t support native file watchers.
Check every file for changes several times a second at a fixed interval.
Check every file for changes several times a second, but use heuristics to check certain types of files less frequently than others.
Use a dynamic queue where less-frequently modified files will be checked less often.
packageNLS.configuration.tsserver.watchOptions.sync: Disable deferred watching on directories. Deferred watching is useful when lots of file changes might occur at once (e.g. a change in node_modules from running npm install), but you might want to disable it with this flag for some less-common setups.
packageNLS.typescript.preferences.renameShorthandPr: The setting 'typescript.preferences.renameShorthandProperties' has been deprecated in favor of 'typescript.preferences.useAliasesForRenames'
packageNLS.typescript.preferences.useAliasesForRena: Enable/disable introducing aliases for object shorthand properties during renames. Requires using TypeScript 3.4 or newer in the workspace.
packageNLS.typescript.workspaceSymbols.scope: Controls which files are searched by [go to symbol in workspace](https://code.visualstudio.com/docs/editor/editingevolved#_open-symbol-by-name).
packageNLS.typescript.workspaceSymbols.scope.allOpe: Search all open JavaScript or TypeScript projects for symbols. Requires using TypeScript 3.9 or newer in the workspace.
packageNLS.typescript.workspaceSymbols.scope.curren: Only search for symbols in the current JavaScript or TypeScript project.
packageNLS.codeActions.refactor.extract.function.de: Extract expression to method or function.
packageNLS.codeActions.refactor.extract.type.title: Extract type
packageNLS.codeActions.refactor.extract.type.descri: Extract type to a type alias.
packageNLS.codeActions.refactor.rewrite.import.desc: Convert between named imports and namespace imports.
packageNLS.codeActions.refactor.rewrite.export.desc: Convert between default export and named export.
packageNLS.codeActions.refactor.move.newFile.title: Move to a new file
packageNLS.codeActions.refactor.move.newFile.descri: Move the expression to a new file.
packageNLS.codeActions.refactor.rewrite.arrow.brace: Add or remove braces in an arrow function.
packageNLS.codeActions.source.organizeImports.title: Organize imports

packageNLS.description: Provides snippets, syntax highlighting, bracket matching and folding in Visual Basic files.
Provides syntax highlighting and bracket matching in XML files.
Provides syntax highlighting and bracket matching in YAML files.

packageJSON.name: dart-code
packageJSON.description: Dart language support and debugger for Visual Studio Code.

colors.description: The color of the 'closing label' annotations shown against constructor, method invocations and lists that span multiple lines. If not supplied, the color for 'tab.inactiveForeground' will be used.

packageJSON.name: Kotlin
packageJSON.description: Kotlin language support for VS Code, this file is modified by github1s

packageJSON.name: vscode-vlang
packageJSON.description: V language support (syntax highlighting, formatter, linter, snippets) for Visual Studio Code.
